content.formatted_body:
In reply to @bakkot:matrix.org
made that matrix log bot I promised: https://bakkot.github.io/matrix-logs/
super awesome! thanks!

content.body: bakkot: Huh, can you make it scrape the logs from back before it started and present those as well?
content.formatted_body: bakkot: Huh, can you make it scrape the logs from back before it started and present those as well?

content.body: littledan: it does that
bakkot: oh, is there a way to get the whole log, not just the log for a particular day?
content.formatted_body: bakkot: oh, is there a way to get the whole log, not just the log for a particular day?

content.body: littledan: not as yet. the whole log can get very long, so you'd want to paginate, which you can do from https://view.matrix.org/room/!WgJwmjBNZEXhJnXHXw:matrix.org/
content.formatted_body: littledan: not as yet. the whole log can get very long, so you'd want to paginate, which you can do from https://view.matrix.org/room/!WgJwmjBNZEXhJnXHXw:matrix.org/

content.body: you can also clone the repo which hosts them I guess: https://github.com/bakkot/matrix-logs
well, yeah, Waldemar's specific request was to have the complete log
we already had the paginated log
we never had that for IRC, as far as I recall; this log works almost exactly like IRC log bots do
but sure, I can also generate a text file with everything in it
I assumed he just wanted the ability to view old logs without clicking "load more" an indeterminate and increasing number of times
that's what I wanted, at any rate
I don't quite understand the motivation for the request; it's possible I was misunderstanding. Probably best to follow up with him.
I think the "show more" links already fulfilled the requirement that the logs be publicly accessible
littledan: what i thought waldemar was asking for is a downloadable text file he can grep through locally
content.formatted_body: littledan: what i thought waldemar was asking for is a downloadable text file he can grep through locally

content.body: shu: What I don't understand is why this is a requirement when, as bakkot said, this did not quite exist for IRC
content.formatted_body: shu: What I don't understand is why this is a requirement when, as bakkot said, this did not quite exist for IRC

content.body: it seems like an achievable thing to provide, though
oh that i don't know either
maybe he was relying on irccloud's log export or something
Yeah, it'll be straightforward, I might as well
